title: 1776 Commission
deleted: In conjunction with this newly founded commission, all schools with be now be required to add Mein Kempf to their course catalogs. If students are unable to read in its original German, the English version will suffice.
Recommended course content will be as followed:
Lessons on Obstruction of Justice (101): Professor William Barr
The Coronavirus and You: That Plandemic Lady
Urban De-planning and the Destruction of Western Civilization: Dr. Professor Ben Carson
Any Alternative Facts will be provided by Kellyanne Conway.
All schools will be required to institute the new materials no sooner than Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany creates binders for the curriculum, and will be mandatory by November 3rd, 2020.

title: 1776 Commission
added: U.S. President [[Donald Trump]] had first talked about an "patriotic education" as early as September 2 2020.<ref>https://www.nbc4i.com/news/u-s-world/trump-pushes-for-patriotic-education-in-schools/</ref><ref>https://www.cbs8.com/article/news/politics/national-politics/president-trump-calls-for-patriotic-education-in-us-schools/67-fa91b004-8c6c-49ed-84e2-549c39753684</ref>

title: 1776 Commission
deleted: It strikes me the user suggesting deletion is politically motivated. My belief is his/her real objection is to President Trump, an honorific s/he does not use.
There are those of us who find a 1776 Commission curriculum in schools far superior to the 1619 Project currently being promulgated.

I second that this post remain active. The proposed deletion seems politically motivated. Trump has identified the members of the commission, which includes an Ivy League history professor. Please allow the facts to emerge.
